revised_title: The Study of Spectral Lines and Their Reversals in the Chromosphere
tldr: The author investigates the discrepancies between the intensities of spectral lines observed in laboratories and those seen by Young in his research on the chromosphere. They analyze the spectra of various elements, discussing the possibility of impurities and the role of temperature in the formation of spectral lines. The author also explores the concept of rhythm in the formation of spectral lines and its implications for the understanding of elemental bodies.
